abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Roads Project
            for India is to achieve broader and more sustainable access
            to markets and social services by the rural population in
            participating districts. The project is being implemented in
            four states i.e. Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Rajasthan, and
            Uttar Pradesh. Jharkhand has not performed well under the
            project although planned works on 150 km of roads in that
            state are nearly completed. Under a previous restructuring,
            funds that were originally allocated for use in Jharkhand
            were reallocated to Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan. The
            extension will help the National Rural Roads Development
            Agency (NRRDA) and the participating states to: (a) further
            consolidate the institutional development initiatives,
            including innovative methods to plan and execute maintenance
            works; (b) complete the ongoing and additional rural roads
            works to be taken up from the recently reallocated funds to
            Uttar Pradesh ($ 27 m) and Rajasthan ($ 9 m). These works
            are scheduled for completion by December 2011. In addition,
            some ongoing works in Himachal Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh
            will not be complete until December 31, 2010; and, (c)
            undertake further capacity building activities planned for
            rural roads agencies.
